ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to sing much better, sing with a mix voice, imitate an opera singer, and I gained confidence!
This class taught me about composers of Spanish and Italian art songs and practical knowledge of vocal technique.
I learned art songs in the bel canto and spanish-folk style by Liszt, Bellini, Rossini, Obradors, Turina etc.
I learned a lot of new repertoire and got a lot more comfortable performing solo vocal repertoire in front of live audiences.
I learned a vast and varied selection of vocal repertoire and received insight into the lives of many different composers.
I took this class as a pianist, and learned and accompanied 37 - thirty seven! - songs over the course of the semester with various singers in the class.

Considerable expansion of my art song repertoire as well as my knowledge of the history of European music (specifically regarding Spain and Italy, of course). Impressive improvement in my vocal technique and pronunciation of Spanish and Italian.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: feedback is immediate and understandable. There are lots of opportunities to improve, and lots of outside help (Prof. Lallis office hours and coaching with Sarah). 

Weakness: the communication could be improved in this class. Sometimes, it wasnt clear which songs we were supposed to be singing in class, or in the concerts.

This course is the perfect course for people looking to improve solo voice performance. The strengths were the fact that you are just constantly learning and expanding your rep. The weakness was probably the occasional busy work we had. It wasn't that big of a deal ever but felt occasionally pointless.

I liked that the emphasis was really on learning repertoire, while other aspects of the course were supplementary.  I enjoyed the drop-the-needle quizzes  it was a good way for me to get familiar with a lot of art songs other than the ones I had chosen to learn.  I also liked that most of the classes were run studio-class-style, with each student performing the song they had learned that week and then getting comments on it.  I sometimes felt like I didn't gain a whole lot from the comments that were given to me or to other people.  Sometimes they were helpful, but sometimes I felt like the things that I was actually struggling with in the piece were ignored in favor of other less important details.  I would've generally liked to have been held to a higher standard  I really wanted to take this class as an opportunity to improve as a vocalist, but instead it felt a bit like all I was doing was learning repertoire.
It could do with more even distribution of concerts across the semester so as to alleviate some accelerated stress.
The strength of the class is simply to learn a ton of rep, which I think is super helpful for the development of young singers/pianists.

Strengths: this course is a joy to attend and is effective in achieving the student's goals. 
Weaknesses: Nothing comes to mind, so why make something up?

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this to someone who wants to work to improve their singing.
Yes absolutely! If you are a fairly strong singer looking to improve your technique and expand your rep, this class is for you.
Its a wonderful excuse to learn music. Whether youre a singer or not it pushes you to explore a certain repertoire and your own voice in the process.
YES! Love Prof. Lalli's art song classes. Really a gem of the music department!

extras.title: MUSI 326 01 - Art Songs of Italy and Spain
